alert.note: Alert for Middle Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 12:21PM AKDT until September 07 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occuring. * WHERE...Tanana River from Salcha to downstream of Fairbanks. * WHEN...Until 300 PM AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is occurring in low lying areas along the Tanana River from Salcha to downstream of Fairbanks, and is expected to continue for several more days. Near Fairbanks, some water remains ponded on portions of Perkins Drive, Melanie Lane, and Chief John Drive. Several driveways and yards have water in them and one section of Perkins Drive has water over a foot deep. The Tanana River is expected to remain near bankfull and fluctuate slightly the next several days, with water ponded in low lying areas remaining for at least several more days. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1159 AM AKDT Mon, The Tanana River in Fairbanks is bankfull, and will fall very slowly this week. Rain over the next several days will cause water levels to fluctuate slightly. Minor flooding is occuring along Perkins Drive, Melanie Lane and Chief John Drive just downstream of Fairbanks, and is likely occuring in other low spots along the Tanana River from Salcha to downstream of Fairbanks. - For those recreating or hunting on the Tanana River, all gravel bars will be covered with water, debris will be in the river, along with increased erosion. Be cautious of fluctuating water levels if you plan to park your vehicle near the river while out on your boat. - For Tanana River at Fairbanks: At 11:15am Mon the stage was 23.81 feet. Flood Stage is 24.5 feet. Forecast: The river is expected to fall very slowly this week, but will fluctuate slightly with rainfall over the next several days. - http://www.weather.gov/aprfc If you live near or along the Tanana River from Salcha to downstream of Fairbanks stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
